column4: The network manager in buntu with the VPN support is so intuitive....they need to work on that.
Does anyone else hate the network manager?
yes, and my number one reason is that it's VPN config section is unavailable when not using 'roaming mode'
I TOTALLY agree!
Do you use wifi?
i was..  but i've upgraded to gutsy and need to recompile madwifi (macbook c2d)
Oh macbook...ahh I see
But you can "manually configure" your wifi and take it off roaming
and madwifi still has a bug that is really a bother with my wifi shipset
Yea macs have some troubles
roaming mode works great for me, for everything except my parents' random static ip dsl
Well even on my linksys router....with no encryption and DHCP....I cannot connect until I go off of roaming....
for the most part, however, ubuntu on my macbook is working wonderfully, integrating with an all M$ office no problems, vpn, rdp, exchange, smb over vpn, all god

now that is strange...  i had great luck, before coming to my parents to visit, with roaming mode and wpa2 security, dhcp, and it also remembered my preferred network even when it wasn't the strongest signal available
yeah, windows file sharing with a m$ vpn
Yea, I can connect to other peoples wifi in this building, except my own....have to go roaming

to be quite honest, my networkmanger troubles, save the 'no vpn while off roaming' thing, all worked themselves out without too much fuss..  at this point i can't honestly remember exactly what i did to get things smooth
hmm, mine are still that way....oh well
i tell ya tho, i think they'll whip network manager into shape in the near future, for what it is, its pretty good
I will agree, its alright, just needs some work
there are some things that are way better, imho, than the way other 'popular' os's work
Oh yea, Linux Mint's old network manager sucked so bad, but with the new one...it still needs work.
